lexUnit.name: forgive.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: stop feeling angry or resentful towards (someone) for an offence or mistake.

sentence.text: Christians believe that Jesus forgives their sins and that this is an important part of their relationship with him -- the paralysed man ( Mark 2:1-12 ) .
He begged her to forgive him all he had done amiss , and alter a pause he said , “ God has forgiven all my sins . ' ”
Where 's the point in that , if you 'll forgive the pun ?
He never forgave the Nazis ; they were always his enemies .
Captain Kirk ( William Shatner ) hates the idea -- he ca n't forgive his old enemies for the death of his son .
Khrushchev could never forgive him for the cruelties and stupidities that brought Russia so close to defeat by Hitler .
What he was saying made sense in some respects but she would never , ever forgive Lizzy for the charade of the last eighteen months .
She 's forgiven me for being such an ass with my ultimatum the other day , " he added , then sighed , ` I do wish she was coming back to her flat . "
Gosse 's friends invariably forgave him for his wayward humour .
The company seems to have been forgiven for its oil spill in the Mersey estuary in 1989 ; it came third in ` community and environmental responsibility " , only one place down from last time .
I know that you 've never forgiven me for what happened , and I do n't blame you , darling .
` Well ! " he said , ` I hope you 'll forgive me for having knocked you down that day . "
At the end of August he received another letter from Leopold telling him that the archbishop had forgiven him and wanted a reconciliation .
The 1930s were hard times , so I think they will be forgiven for this slight oversight .
You could forgive Debby Cumming for being a not-so-youthful Alice as she stomped and skipped like the naughtiest girl in the class .
He 'll never forgive her for the life she has spent and she wo n't let him see what she 's come to at the end of it !
The author craves to be forgiven for a very brief self-quotation in illustration of this from a work of his own :
Mrs Major could be forgiven for seeing Maastricht mud deposited across the carpets .
Listening to the debate and the old-fashioned ideas of male supremacy it unearthed , you could have been forgiven for thinking that we were still in the 16th Century .
The Navaho had respected Rope Thrower as a warrior , but could never forgive the destruction of their prized orchards .
